Paper.Title: Sydney, July 2006. c(c)2006 Association for Computational Linguistics Data Selection in Semi-supervised Learning for Name Tagging

Section.Paragraph: We present two semi-supervised learning techniques to improve a state-of-the-art multi-lingual name tagger. For English and Chinese, the overall system obtains 1.7% - 2.1% improvement in F-measure, representing a 13.5% - 17.4% relative reduction in the spurious, missing, and incorrect tags. We also conclude that simply relying upon large corpora is not in itself sufficient: we must pay attention to unlabeled data selection too. We describe effective measures to automatically select documents and sentences.
